org.gearvrf.animation

Interface GVROnFinish

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    GVROnRepeat

    public interface GVROnFinish
    Optional on-finish callback

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void finished(GVRAnimation animation)
      Optional callback: called when the animation is complete, and has stopped running.

    • Method Detail

      • finished

        void finished(GVRAnimation animation)
        Optional callback: called when the animation is complete, and has stopped running.

        With the default, run-once animation, this is pretty straight forward: the animation will run to completion and finished() will be called. Note that repeat mode ONCE overrides any repeat count.

        The repetitive types REPEATED and PINGPONG do pay attention to the repeat count. With a positive repeat count, the animation will run for the specified number of times, and then call finished(). Note that the GVRAnimation.DEFAULT_REPEAT_COUNT is 2.

        If the repeat count is negative, the animation will run until you stop it. There are three ways you can do this:

        • You can call GVRAnimationEngine.stop(GVRAnimation). This will stop the animation immediately, regardless of the current state of the animated property, so this is generally appropriate only for pop-up objects like Please Wait spinners that are about to disappear. Calling stop() will not trigger the finished() callback.
        • You can call setRepeatCount(0) to schedule a graceful termination, at the end of the current animation cycle: this will also call finished().
        • If the callback is also a GVROnRepeat, the GVROnRepeat.iteration(GVRAnimation, int) method will be called at the end of each animation cycle. (This is the best way to terminate a ping pong animation, as you can be sure that you are leaving the animated property in its start state.) When iteration returns false, the animation will be stopped, and finish will be called.
        Parameters:
        animation - The animation that just finished, so you can use the same callback with multiple animations.
